channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

item.title: Report E-2024010536
item.description:
Report E-2024010536

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: BENTON
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Transfer facility personnel transferred containers from one trailer to another. Containers were intact with no damage or leaks when unloaded from initial trailer. When driver inspected trailer that the containers were transferred to, one tote was found with a puncture in the lower sidewall near a corner. Transfer facility personnel estimated about 25 gallons of paint had leaked from the tote onto the floor of the trailer and dock. The leak was stopped. Content of the damaged tote was transferred to drums. Leaked material was absorbed and placed in drums.

item.title: Report X-2024010512
item.description:
Report X-2024010512

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-05T15:13:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-12
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered during sort operations. 1 pallet from Sams Club containing: 55 packages of "Tons 'O Fun" each pack contained 532 pieces, 82 Party Poppers, 450 Snappers, 24 Confetti Cannon Packs (12 per pack). NO Release. The shipment is being held for FAA investigation.
